when_to_say: Used as a greeting at any time of day
example: ¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás? (oh-lah koh-moh eh-stahs) - Hello! How are you?

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude or thanks
example: Muchas gracias por tu ayuda (moo-chahs grah-see-ahs pohr too ah-yoo-dah) - Thank you very much for your help

when_to_say: Used when making requests or asking for something politely
example: Un café, por favor (oon kah-feh pohr fah-vohr) - A coffee, please

when_to_say: Used when saying goodbye or farewell
example: ¡Adiós, hasta mañana! (ah-dee-ohs ah-stah mah-nyah-nah) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used to express agreement or affirmation
example: Sí, estoy de acuerdo (see, eh-stoy deh ah-kwer-doh) - Yes, I agree

when_to_say: Used to express negation or disagreement
example: No, gracias (noh, grah-see-ahs) - No, thank you

when_to_say: Used as a greeting in the morning until noon
example: ¡Buenos días! ¿Cómo amaneciste? (bweh-nohs dee-ahs koh-moh ah-mah-neh-see-steh) - Good morning! How did you wake up?

when_to_say: Used as a greeting or farewell in the evening/night
example: Buenas noches, hasta mañana (bweh-nahs noh-chehs, ah-stah mah-nyah-nah) - Good night, see you tomorrow

when_to_say: Used when referring to yourself
example: Yo soy estudiante (yoh soy eh-stoo-dee-ahn-teh) - I am a student

when_to_say: Used when addressing someone informally
example: ¿Cómo estás tú? (koh-moh eh-stahs too) - How are you?

when_to_say: Used when referring to a male person
example: Él es mi hermano (ehl ehs mee ehr-mah-noh) - He is my brother

when_to_say: Used when referring to a female person
example: Ella es mi hermana (eh-yah ehs mee ehr-mah-nah) - She is my sister

when_to_say: Used when referring to a group including yourself
example: Nosotros vamos al parque (noh-soh-trohs bah-mohs ahl pahr-keh) - We are going to the park

when_to_say: Used when referring to a group of people
example: Ellos son mis amigos (eh-yohs sohn mees ah-mee-gohs) - They are my friends

when_to_say: Used when meeting someone for the first time
example: ¡Mucho gusto en conocerte! (moo-choh goo-stoh ehn koh-noh-sehr-teh) - Nice to meet you!

when_to_say: Used when saying goodbye with the intention to meet again
example: ¡Hasta luego, amigo! (ah-stah lweh-goh, ah-mee-goh) - See you later, friend!

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention politely
example: Perdón, ¿puede repetir? (pehr-dohn, pweh-deh reh-peh-teer) - Excuse me, can you repeat that?

when_to_say: Used in response to 'thank you'
example: De nada, fue un placer (deh nah-dah, fweh oon plah-sehr) - You're welcome, it was a pleasure

when_to_say: In formal introductions or when describing warm, friendly interactions
example: Su cordialidad fue evidente (Soo kor-dee-a-LEE-dad fweh eh-vee-DEN-teh) - His cordiality was evident

when_to_say: Describing someone's enthusiastic or overly emotional greeting
example: Él es muy efusivo al saludar (El es moo-ee eh-foo-SEE-vo al sa-loo-DAR) - He is very effusive when greeting

when_to_say: Describing a friendly, warm relationship between people
example: La camaradería entre ellos era notable (La ka-ma-ra-DEH-ree-a EN-treh EH-yos EH-ra no-TA-bleh) - The camaraderie between them was notable

when_to_say: Discussing formal greetings or social interactions
example: Siguió el protocolo de presentación (see-GYEE-o el pro-to-KO-lo de pre-sen-ta-see-ON) - He followed the introduction protocol

when_to_say: Describing a polite, measured approach to social interactions
example: Su comedimiento impresionó a todos (Soo ko-meh-dee-mee-EN-to eem-pre-see-O-no a TO-dos) - His restraint impressed everyone

when_to_say: When congratulating someone or wishing them well
example: ¡Enhorabuena por tu logro! (en-o-ra-BWEH-na por too LO-gro) - Congratulations on your achievement!

when_to_say: Describing polite behavior or manners
example: Mostró gran cortesía al saludar (mos-TRO gran kor-teh-SEE-a al sa-loo-DAR) - He showed great courtesy when greeting

when_to_say: Describing respectful behavior towards others
example: Trató al anciano con deferencia (tra-TO al an-see-A-no kon deh-feh-REN-see-a) - He treated the elderly man with deference

when_to_say: Describing the act of trying to gain favor or make a good impression
example: Intentó congraciar con sus nuevos colegas (een-TEN-to kon-gra-see-AR kon soos NWEH-vos ko-LEH-gas) - He tried to win over his new colleagues

when_to_say: Describing a sincere or authentic greeting or interaction
example: Su saludo fue genuino (Soo sa-LOO-do fweh heh-NOO-ee-no) - His greeting was genuine

when_to_say: Describing polite and attentive behavior, especially towards women
example: Mostró gran galantería al recibirla (mos-TRO gran ga-lan-teh-REE-a al reh-see-BEER-la) - He showed great gallantry when receiving her

when_to_say: Describing agreement or silent approval in social interactions
example: Dio su anuencia con un gesto (DEE-o soo a-NOO-en-see-a kon oon HES-to) - He gave his consent with a gesture

when_to_say: Used when referring to water
example: Necesito un vaso de agua (neh-seh-see-toh oon bah-soh deh ah-gwah) - I need a glass of water

when_to_say: Used when referring to food or meals
example: La comida está lista (lah koh-mee-dah eh-stah lee-stah) - The food is ready

when_to_say: Used when referring to bread
example: Quiero comprar pan fresco (kyeh-roh kohm-prahr pahn frehs-koh) - I want to buy fresh bread

when_to_say: Used when referring to milk
example: Bebo leche cada mañana (beh-boh leh-cheh kah-dah mah-nyah-nah) - I drink milk every morning

when_to_say: Used when referring to coffee
example: Me gusta el café negro (meh goo-stah ehl kah-feh neh-groh) - I like black coffee

when_to_say: Used when referring to apples
example: La manzana está roja (lah mahn-sah-nah eh-stah roh-hah) - The apple is red

when_to_say: Used when referring to bananas
example: Me como un plátano (meh koh-moh oon plah-tah-noh) - I'm eating a banana

when_to_say: Used when referring to eggs
example: Quiero dos huevos (kyeh-roh dohs weh-vohs) - I want two eggs

when_to_say: Used when referring to meat
example: No como carne (noh koh-moh kahr-neh) - I don't eat meat

when_to_say: Used when referring to fish
example: Me gusta el pescado fresco (meh goo-stah ehl pehs-kah-doh frehs-koh) - I like fresh fish

when_to_say: Used when referring to rice
example: El arroz está listo (ehl ah-rrohs eh-stah lees-toh) - The rice is ready

when_to_say: Used when referring to soup
example: La sopa está caliente (lah soh-pah eh-stah kah-lee-ehn-teh) - The soup is hot

when_to_say: Used when referring to salad
example: Quiero una ensalada fresca (kyeh-roh oo-nah ehn-sah-lah-dah frehs-kah) - I want a fresh salad

when_to_say: Used when referring to juice
example: Un vaso de jugo de naranja (oon bah-soh deh hoo-goh deh nah-rahn-hah) - A glass of orange juice

when_to_say: Used when referring to dessert
example: ¿Qué hay de postre? (keh ah-ee deh pohs-treh) - What's for dessert?

when_to_say: Used when referring to cookies
example: Me gustan las galletas (meh goo-stahn lahs gah-yeh-tahs) - I like cookies

when_to_say: Used when referring to ice cream
example: Quiero un helado de chocolate (kyeh-roh oon eh-lah-doh deh choh-koh-lah-teh) - I want a chocolate ice cream

when_to_say: Used when referring to sugar
example: Sin azúcar, por favor (seen ah-soo-kahr pohr fah-vohr) - Without sugar, please

when_to_say: Referring to a chef specialized in preparing appetizers or small dishes
example: El entremesista preparó un menú exquisito (El en-treh-meh-SEES-ta pre-pa-RO oon meh-NOO ex-kee-SEE-to) - The appetizer specialist prepared an exquisite menu

when_to_say: When referring to a type of sandwich or small meal
example: Un bocadillo de jamón (Oon bo-ka-DEE-yo de ha-MON) - A ham sandwich

when_to_say: Describing a traditional Spanish cold soup
example: En verano, me encanta el gazpacho (En veh-RA-no, meh en-KAN-ta el gaz-PAH-cho) - In summer, I love gazpacho

when_to_say: Describing high-quality or sophisticated food
example: Un restaurante gourmet (Oon res-tau-RAN-teh goor-MEH) - A gourmet restaurant

when_to_say: Referring to a shop selling cured meats and delicacies
example: Compré jamón en la charcutería (kom-PREH ha-MON en la char-koo-teh-REE-a) - I bought ham at the delicatessen

when_to_say: Describing the act of eating small bites or snacks
example: Nos dedicamos al picoteo toda la tarde (Nos deh-dee-KA-mos al pee-ko-TEH-o TO-da la TAR-deh) - We spent the whole afternoon snacking

when_to_say: Describing something that can be eaten
example: Revisa si es comestible (reh-VEE-sa see es ko-mess-TEE-bleh) - Check if it's edible

when_to_say: Referring to a traditional Spanish tavern or wine cellar
example: Cenamos en un bodegón tradicional (seh-NA-mos en oon bo-deh-GON tra-dee-see-o-NAL) - We had dinner in a traditional tavern

when_to_say: Describing someone who enjoys eating tapas
example: Soy un tapeador experimentado (Soy oon ta-peh-a-DOR ex-peh-ree-men-TA-do) - I'm an experienced tapas enthusiast

when_to_say: When talking about adding seasonings to food
example: Necesito condimentar la carne (neh-seh-SEE-to kon-dee-men-TAR la KAR-neh) - I need to season the meat

when_to_say: Discussing culinary arts or regional cuisine
example: La gastronomía española es muy variada (La gas-tro-no-MEE-a es-pa-ÑO-la es moo-ee va-ree-A-da) - Spanish gastronomy is very diverse

when_to_say: Discussing food portions or serving sizes
example: Controla el acotamiento de tu comida (kon-TRO-la el a-ko-ta-mee-EN-to de too ko-MEE-da) - Control the portion size of your food

when_to_say: Used when referring to a house or home
example: Mi casa es grande (mee kah-sah ehs grahn-deh) - My house is big

when_to_say: Used when referring to a room
example: Esta es mi habitación (ehs-tah ehs mee ah-bee-tah-see-ohn) - This is my room

when_to_say: Used when referring to a kitchen
example: La cocina está limpia (lah koh-see-nah ehs-tah leem-pee-ah) - The kitchen is clean

when_to_say: Used when referring to a bathroom
example: ¿Dónde está el baño? (dohn-deh ehs-tah ehl bah-nyoh) - Where is the bathroom?

when_to_say: Used when referring to a bedroom
example: El dormitorio está arriba (ehl dohr-mee-tohr-ee-oh ehs-tah ah-rree-bah) - The bedroom is upstairs

when_to_say: Used when referring to a living room
example: La sala es espaciosa (lah sah-lah ehs ehs-pah-see-oh-sah) - The living room is spacious

when_to_say: Used when referring to a table
example: La mesa es redonda (lah meh-sah ehs reh-dohn-dah) - The table is round

when_to_say: Used when referring to a chair
example: Siéntate en la silla (see-ehn-tah-teh ehn lah see-yah) - Sit on the chair

when_to_say: Used when referring to a bed
example: Mi cama es cómoda (mee kah-mah ehs koh-moh-dah) - My bed is comfortable

when_to_say: Used when referring to a window
example: Abre la ventana (ah-breh lah behn-tah-nah) - Open the window

when_to_say: Used when referring to a door
example: Cierra la puerta (see-eh-rrah lah pwehr-tah) - Close the door

when_to_say: Used when referring to a sofa or couch
example: El sofá es nuevo (ehl soh-fah ehs nweh-boh) - The sofa is new

when_to_say: Used when referring to a closet or wardrobe
example: Mi ropa está en el armario (mee roh-pah ehs-tah ehn ehl ahr-mah-ree-oh) - My clothes are in the closet

when_to_say: Used when referring to a mirror
example: Me miro en el espejo (meh mee-roh ehn ehl ehs-peh-hoh) - I look at myself in the mirror

when_to_say: Used when referring to a lamp
example: Enciende la lámpara (ehn-see-ehn-deh lah lahm-pah-rah) - Turn on the lamp

when_to_say: Used when referring to a rug or carpet
example: La alfombra es suave (lah ahl-fohm-brah ehs swah-beh) - The rug is soft

when_to_say: Used when referring to a desk
example: Trabajo en mi escritorio (trah-bah-hoh ehn mee ehs-kree-tohr-ee-oh) - I work at my desk

when_to_say: Used when referring to a bookshelf
example: Los libros están en la estantería (lohs lee-brohs ehs-tahn ehn lah ehs-tahn-teh-ree-ah) - The books are on the bookshelf

when_to_say: Discussing furniture design, comfort, and functionality
example: Este sillón tiene una ergonomía perfecta (ES-teh see-YON tee-EH-neh OO-na er-go-no-MEE-a per-FEK-ta) - This armchair has perfect ergonomics

when_to_say: Referring to a piece of furniture used for removing shoes
example: Dejé mis zapatos en el descalzador (deh-HEH mees sa-PA-tos en el des-kal-sa-DOR) - I left my shoes on the shoe rack

when_to_say: Describing a piece of furniture for storing dishes or displaying decorative items
example: Guardamos la vajilla en el aparador (gwar-DA-mos la va-HEE-ya en el a-pa-ra-DOR) - We store the dishes in the sideboard

when_to_say: Discussing interior design and decorative elements
example: Su decorativismo es muy elegante (Soo deh-ko-ra-tee-VEES-mo es moo-ee eh-leh-GAN-teh) - His decorative style is very elegant

when_to_say: Referring to a wall-mounted or standalone shelf
example: Coloqué los libros en la repisa (ko-lo-KEH los LEE-bros en la reh-PEE-sa) - I placed the books on the shelf

when_to_say: Describing furniture covered with fabric or leather
example: Un sillón tapizado en cuero (Oon see-YON ta-pee-SA-do en KWE-ro) - An upholstered leather armchair

when_to_say: Discussing the process of furnishing a room or home
example: Completamos el amoblamiento de la sala (kom-pleh-TA-mos el a-mo-bla-mee-EN-to de la SA-la) - We completed the furnishing of the living room

when_to_say: Referring to a specific shelf or shelving section
example: Organizó los libros en el entrepaño (or-ga-nee-SO los LEE-bros en el en-treh-PA-nyo) - He organized the books on the shelf

when_to_say: Discussing flexible, adjustable furniture design
example: La modulación permite configurar el espacio (La mo-doo-la-see-ON per-MEE-teh kon-fee-goo-RAR el es-PA-see-o) - The modular design allows configuring the space

when_to_say: When talking about decorating or adding ornamental elements
example: Voy a ornamentar la estantería (Voy a or-na-men-TAR la es-tan-teh-REE-a) - I'm going to decorate the bookshelf

when_to_say: Discussing professional interior design and decoration
example: Estudió interiorismo en Madrid (es-too-DEE-o een-teh-ree-o-REES-mo en ma-DREES) - He studied interior design in Madrid

when_to_say: Describing furniture designed for comfort and efficiency
example: Un escritorio ergonomizado reduce el cansancio (Oon es-kree-TO-ree-o er-go-no-mee-SA-do reh-DOO-seh el kan-SAN-see-o) - An ergonomically designed desk reduces fatigue

when_to_say: Used when counting or referring to the number one
example: Quiero uno más (kyeh-roh oo-noh mahs) - I want one more

when_to_say: Used when counting or referring to the number two
example: Tengo dos hermanos (tehn-goh dohs ehr-mah-nohs) - I have two brothers

when_to_say: Used when counting or referring to the number three
example: Hay tres libros (ah-ee trehs lee-brohs) - There are three books

when_to_say: Used when asking or telling time
example: ¿Qué hora es? (keh oh-rah ehs) - What time is it?

when_to_say: Used when referring to minutes
example: Espera un minuto (ehs-peh-rah oon mee-noo-toh) - Wait a minute

when_to_say: Used when counting or referring to the number ten
example: Tengo diez dólares (tehn-goh dee-ehs doh-lah-rehs) - I have ten dollars

when_to_say: Used when counting or referring to the number twenty
example: Veinte personas (beh-een-teh pehr-soh-nahs) - Twenty people

when_to_say: Used when counting or referring to the number thirty
example: Treinta días (treh-een-tah dee-ahs) - Thirty days

when_to_say: Used when referring to noon/midday
example: Almuerzo al mediodía (ahl-mwehr-soh ahl meh-dee-oh-dee-ah) - I have lunch at noon

when_to_say: Used when referring to midnight
example: A medianoche (ah meh-dee-ah-noh-cheh) - At midnight

when_to_say: Used when referring to early time
example: Me levanto temprano (meh leh-bahn-toh tehm-prah-noh) - I wake up early

when_to_say: Used when referring to late time or afternoon
example: Llegas tarde (yeh-gahs tahr-deh) - You're arriving late

when_to_say: Used when referring to a week
example: La próxima semana (lah proh-see-mah seh-mah-nah) - Next week

when_to_say: Used when referring to a month
example: El mes pasado (ehl mehs pah-sah-doh) - Last month

when_to_say: Used when referring to a year
example: Feliz año nuevo (feh-lees ah-nyoh nweh-boh) - Happy new year

when_to_say: Used when referring to a calendar
example: Mira el calendario (mee-rah ehl kah-lehn-dah-ree-oh) - Look at the calendar

when_to_say: Used when referring to a second (time)
example: Espera un segundo (ehs-peh-rah oon seh-goon-doh) - Wait a second

when_to_say: Used when referring to a clock or watch
example: ¿Tienes un reloj? (tee-eh-nehs oon reh-loh) - Do you have a watch?

when_to_say: Discussing precise time measurement
example: El cronómetro marcaba exactamente 5 minutos (el kro-NO-meh-tro mar-KA-ba ek-sak-ta-MEN-teh 5 mee-NOO-tos) - The stopwatch was marking exactly 5 minutes

when_to_say: Talking about number systems
example: El sistema decimal usa diez dígitos (el sees-TEH-ma deh-see-MAL oo-sa dee-EZ dee-HEE-tos) - The decimal system uses ten digits

when_to_say: Discussing philosophical or linguistic concepts of time
example: La temporalidad es un concepto complejo (la tem-po-ra-lee-DAD es un kon-SEP-to kom-PLEH-ho) - Temporality is a complex concept

when_to_say: Discussing mathematical divisions
example: Una fracción representa parte de un todo (oo-na frak-SYON re-pre-SEN-ta par-teh deh oon TO-do) - A fraction represents part of a whole

when_to_say: Discussing extremely short time intervals
example: Un nanosegundo es una millonésima de segundo (oon na-no-seh-GUN-do es oo-na mee-yo-NEH-see-ma deh seh-GUN-do) - A nanosecond is a millionth of a second

when_to_say: Discussing calculations or banking
example: Haz la cuenta de los números (az la KWEN-ta deh los NOO-meh-ros) - Do the count of the numbers

when_to_say: Discussing events happening at the same time
example: La simultaneidad de los eventos es sorprendente (la see-mul-ta-neh-ee-DAD deh los eh-VEN-tos es sor-pren-DEN-teh) - The simultaneity of the events is surprising

when_to_say: Discussing proportions or statistical data
example: El porcentaje de éxito fue alto (el por-sen-TA-heh deh EK-see-to fweh AL-to) - The percentage of success was high

when_to_say: Talking about exactness or accurate measurements
example: La precisión del reloj es importante (la pre-see-SYON del reh-LOH es eem-por-TAN-teh) - The precision of the clock is important

when_to_say: Discussing very small fractions
example: La milésima parte del segundo (la mee-LEH-see-ma PAR-teh del seh-GUN-do) - The thousandth part of a second

when_to_say: Discussing mathematical operations
example: Necesito calcular el tiempo exacto (neh-seh-SEE-to kal-koo-LAR el TEEM-po ek-SAK-to) - I need to calculate the exact time

when_to_say: Discussing the order of events in time
example: La cronología de los eventos es importante (la kro-no-LO-hee-a deh los eh-VEN-tos es eem-por-TAN-teh) - The chronology of events is important

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is red
example: El carro rojo (ehl kah-rroh roh-hoh) - The red car

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is blue
example: El cielo es azul (ehl see-eh-loh ehs ah-sool) - The sky is blue

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is green
example: Me gusta el verde (meh goo-stah ehl behr-deh) - I like green

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is yellow
example: El sol es amarillo (ehl sohl ehs ah-mah-ree-yoh) - The sun is yellow

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is black
example: El gato negro (ehl gah-toh neh-groh) - The black cat

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is white
example: La nieve es blanca (lah nyeh-beh ehs blahn-kah) - The snow is white

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is big
example: Una casa grande (oo-nah kah-sah grahn-deh) - A big house

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is small
example: Un perro pequeño (oon peh-rroh peh-keh-nyoh) - A small dog

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is tall or high
example: Un edificio alto (oon eh-dee-fee-see-oh ahl-toh) - A tall building

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is short or low
example: La mesa es baja (lah meh-sah ehs bah-hah) - The table is low

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is new
example: Un coche nuevo (oon koh-cheh nweh-boh) - A new car

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is old
example: Un libro viejo (oon lee-broh byeh-hoh) - An old book

when_to_say: When describing something that shines or is very bright
example: El sol es muy brillante hoy (The sun is very bright today) [el sol es moy bree-YAN-teh oy]

when_to_say: When describing something that lacks shine or luster
example: El vidrio opaco no deja pasar la luz (The opaque glass doesn't let light through) [el BEE-dree-oh oh-PAH-koh no DEH-ha pah-SAR la loos]

when_to_say: When describing something that can be seen through
example: El agua es transparente (The water is transparent) [el AH-gwa es trans-pah-REN-teh]

when_to_say: When describing something light in color or lacking in color
example: Estás muy pálido, ¿te sientes bien? (You're very pale, are you feeling well?) [es-TAS moy PAH-lee-doh, teh see-EN-tes bee-EN]

when_to_say: When describing a surface that is not shiny or glossy
example: Prefiero el acabado mate para las paredes (I prefer the matte finish for the walls) [preh-fee-EH-roh el ah-kah-BAH-doh MAH-teh PA-rah las pah-REH-des]

when_to_say: When describing bright, intense colors
example: Me gustan los colores vivos (I like bright colors) [meh GOOS-tan lohs koh-LOR-es VEE-vohs]

when_to_say: Discussing color composition or scientific contexts
example: La pigmentación de la pintura es única (la peek-men-ta-SYON deh la peen-TOO-ra es OO-nee-ka) - The pigmentation of the painting is unique

when_to_say: Describing color-related properties
example: El espectro cromático es fascinante (el es-PEK-tro kro-MA-tee-ko es fa-see-NAN-teh) - The chromatic spectrum is fascinating

when_to_say: Discussing subtle color variations
example: Cada tonalidad tiene su propio significado (KA-da to-na-lee-DAD tee-EH-neh su PRO-pyo see-nee-fee-KA-do) - Each shade has its own meaning

when_to_say: Describing multi-colored objects or scenes
example: El paisaje era policromático (el pa-EE-sa-heh EH-ra po-lee-kro-MA-tee-ko) - The landscape was polychromatic

when_to_say: Discussing color intensity
example: La saturación del color afecta la percepción (la sa-tu-ra-SYON del ko-LOR a-FEK-ta la per-sep-SYON) - Color saturation affects perception

when_to_say: Describing color-changing surfaces
example: La mariposa tiene alas iridiscentes (la ma-ree-PO-sa tee-EH-neh A-las ee-ree-dees-SEN-tes) - The butterfly has iridescent wings

when_to_say: Describing single-color designs or art
example: El diseño monocromático es elegante (el dee-SEH-nyo mo-no-kro-MA-tee-ko es eh-leh-GAN-teh) - The monochromatic design is elegant

when_to_say: Discussing subtle color differences
example: Cada matiz tiene un significado especial (KA-da ma-TEEZ tee-EH-neh oon see-nee-fee-KA-do es-peh-SYAL) - Each nuance has a special meaning

when_to_say: Discussing astronomical color phenomena
example: La cromosfera solar tiene colores únicos (la kro-mo-SFEH-ra so-LAR tee-EH-neh ko-LO-res OO-nee-kos) - The solar chromosphere has unique colors

when_to_say: Discussing color composition in art or science
example: Este pigmento produce un color intenso (ES-teh peek-MEN-to pro-DOO-seh oon ko-LOR een-TEN-so) - This pigment produces an intense color

when_to_say: Describing colorless or black and white imagery
example: La fotografía acromática captura detalles sutiles (la fo-to-GRA-fee-a a-kro-MA-tee-ka ka-POO-tra deh-TA-lles soo-TEE-les) - The achromatic photograph captures subtle details

when_to_say: Discussing color theory in art or design
example: El cromatismo influye en la percepción visual (el kro-ma-TEES-mo een-FLOO-yeh en la per-sep-SYON vee-SWAL) - Chromaticism influences visual perception

when_to_say: When referring to your male parent
example: Mi padre trabaja en un hospital (My father works in a hospital) [mee PAH-dreh trah-BAH-ha en un os-pee-TAL]

when_to_say: When referring to your female parent
example: Mi madre cocina muy bien (My mother cooks very well) [mee MAH-dreh koh-SEE-nah moy bee-EN]

when_to_say: When referring to your male sibling
example: Mi hermano menor está en la universidad (My younger brother is in university) [mee er-MAH-noh meh-NOR es-TAH en lah oo-nee-ver-see-DAD]

when_to_say: When referring to your female sibling
example: Mi hermana vive en Madrid (My sister lives in Madrid) [mee er-MAH-nah BEE-beh en mah-DRID]

when_to_say: When referring to your male grandparent
example: Mi abuelo cuenta historias interesantes (My grandfather tells interesting stories) [mee ah-BWEH-loh KWEN-tah ees-TOR-ee-as een-teh-reh-SAN-tes]

when_to_say: When referring to your female grandparent
example: Mi abuela hace galletas deliciosas (My grandmother makes delicious cookies) [mee ah-BWEH-lah AH-seh gah-YEH-tas deh-lee-see-OH-sas]

when_to_say: When referring to your parent's male sibling or brother-in-law
example: Mi tío vive en México (My uncle lives in Mexico) [mee TEE-oh BEE-beh en MEH-hee-koh]

when_to_say: When referring to your parent's female sibling or sister-in-law
example: Mi tía es profesora (My aunt is a teacher) [mee TEE-ah es pro-feh-SOR-ah]

when_to_say: When referring to your aunt or uncle's son
example: Mi primo juega al fútbol (My cousin plays soccer) [mee PREE-moh HWEH-gah al FOOT-bol]

when_to_say: When referring to your aunt or uncle's daughter
example: Mi prima estudia medicina (My cousin studies medicine) [mee PREE-mah es-TOO-dee-ah meh-dee-SEE-nah]

when_to_say: When referring to your sibling's son
example: Mi sobrino tiene cinco años (My nephew is five years old) [mee so-BREE-noh tee-EN-eh SEEN-koh AH-nyos]

when_to_say: When referring to your sibling's daughter
example: Mi sobrina baila ballet (My niece dances ballet) [mee so-BREE-nah BAI-lah bah-YEH]

when_to_say: When referring to a male spouse
example: Mi esposo trabaja desde casa (My husband works from home) [mee es-POH-soh trah-BAH-ha DES-deh KAH-sah]

when_to_say: When referring to a female spouse
example: Mi esposa es arquitecta (My wife is an architect) [mee es-POH-sah es ar-kee-TEK-tah]

when_to_say: When referring to your spouse's father
example: Mi suegro es muy amable (My father-in-law is very kind) [mee SWEH-groh es moy ah-MAH-bleh]

when_to_say: When referring to your spouse's mother
example: Mi suegra hace paella deliciosa (My mother-in-law makes delicious paella) [mee SWEH-grah AH-seh pah-EH-yah deh-lee-see-OH-sah]

when_to_say: When referring to your spouse's brother or your sibling's husband
example: Mi cuñado es ingeniero (My brother-in-law is an engineer) [mee koon-YAH-doh es een-hen-YEHR-oh]

when_to_say: When referring to your spouse's sister or your sibling's wife
example: Mi cuñada vive en Barcelona (My sister-in-law lives in Barcelona) [mee koon-YAH-dah BEE-beh en bar-seh-LOH-nah]

when_to_say: Discussing genetic or legal family connections
example: La consanguinidad determina ciertos derechos legales (la kon-san-gee-nee-DAD deh-ter-MEE-na see-ER-tos deh-REH-chos leh-GAH-les) - Blood relationship determines certain legal rights

when_to_say: Talking about parenthood or lineage
example: Los progenitores son responsables de la crianza (los pro-hen-ee-TO-res son res-pon-SA-bles deh la kree-AN-sa) - Parents are responsible for raising children

when_to_say: Discussing family connections and genealogy
example: El parentesco entre hermanos es fuerte (el pa-ren-TES-ko en-treh er-MA-nos es FWER-teh) - The kinship between siblings is strong

when_to_say: Discussing family history and lineage
example: Investigó su genealogía durante años (een-ves-tee-GO soo hen-eh-a-lo-HEE-a doo-RAN-teh A-nyos) - He investigated his genealogy for years

when_to_say: Talking about family lineage and generations
example: Es descendiente de una familia noble (es deh-sen-DYEN-teh deh oo-na fa-MEE-lee-a NO-bleh) - He is a descendant of a noble family

when_to_say: Discussing marriage and spousal relationships
example: La relación conyugal requiere comunicación (la reh-la-SYON kon-yoo-GAL reh-KEE-reh ko-moo-nee-ka-SYON) - The conjugal relationship requires communication

when_to_say: Discussing birth order in families
example: El primogénito hereda la responsabilidad familiar (el pree-mo-HEH-nee-to eh-REH-da la res-pon-sa-bee-lee-DAD fa-mee-LEER) - The firstborn inherits family responsibility

when_to_say: Discussing family lineage through the male line
example: En algunas culturas, la patrilínea es importante (en al-GOO-nas kool-TOO-ras, la pa-tree-LEE-neh-a es eem-por-TAN-teh) - In some cultures, patrilineal descent is important

when_to_say: Discussing marriage and wedding ceremonies
example: La ceremonia nupcial fue muy emotiva (la seh-reh-MO-nee-a noop-SYAL fweh mwee eh-mo-TEE-va) - The wedding ceremony was very emotional

when_to_say: Discussing social structures and family organization
example: En algunas sociedades existe el matriarcado (en al-GOO-nas so-see-eh-DA-des ek-SEE-steh el ma-tree-AR-ka-do) - In some societies, matriarchy exists

when_to_say: Discussing family connections through marriage
example: Al casarse, ambas familias emparentaron (al ka-SAR-seh, AM-bas fa-MEE-lyas em-pa-ren-TA-ron) - Upon marriage, both families became related

when_to_say: Discussing genetic family relationships
example: Los consanguíneos comparten lazos genéticos (los kon-san-GEE-neh-os kom-PAR-ten LA-sos heh-NEH-tee-kos) - Blood relatives share genetic ties

when_to_say: When giving directions or indicating left side
example: Gira a la izquierda en el semáforo (Turn left at the traffic light) [HEE-rah ah lah ees-kee-ERH-dah en el seh-MAH-fo-ro]

when_to_say: When giving directions or indicating right side
example: La farmacia está a la derecha (The pharmacy is on the right) [lah far-MAH-see-ah es-TAH ah lah deh-REH-chah]

when_to_say: When referring to street corners or intersections
example: Nos vemos en la esquina (See you at the corner) [nos BEH-mos en lah es-KEE-nah]

when_to_say: When referring to a street or road
example: ¿En qué calle vives? (What street do you live on?) [en keh KAH-yeh BEE-bes]

when_to_say: When referring to a public square or plaza
example: La plaza central es muy bonita (The central square is very beautiful) [lah PLAH-sah sen-TRAL es moy boh-NEE-tah]

when_to_say: When referring to a market or marketplace
example: Vamos al mercado a comprar frutas (Let's go to the market to buy fruits) [BAH-mos al mer-KAH-doh ah kom-PRAR FROO-tas]

when_to_say: When referring to a library
example: Estudio en la biblioteca (I study at the library) [es-TOO-dee-oh en lah bee-blee-oh-TEH-kah]

when_to_say: When describing something that is nearby
example: El banco está cerca de aquí (The bank is close to here) [el BAN-koh es-TAH SEHR-kah deh ah-KEE]

when_to_say: When describing something that is far away
example: El aeropuerto está lejos (The airport is far away) [el ah-eh-roh-PWEHR-toh es-TAH LEH-hos]

when_to_say: When referring to the city center or downtown area
example: Vivo en el centro de la ciudad (I live downtown) [BEE-boh en el SEN-troh deh lah see-oo-DAHD]

when_to_say: When asking for or giving an address or direction
example: ¿Cuál es tu dirección? (What is your address?) [koo-AL es too dee-rek-see-ON]

when_to_say: When referring to a train or bus station
example: La estación de tren está allí (The train station is there) [lah es-tah-see-ON deh tren es-TAH ah-YEE]

when_to_say: When describing something located in front of another thing
example: El parque está frente al hospital (The park is in front of the hospital) [el PAR-keh es-TAH FREN-teh al os-pee-TAL]

when_to_say: When referring to a street intersection or crossing
example: Nos encontramos en el cruce (Let's meet at the intersection) [nos en-kon-TRAH-mos en el KROO-seh]

when_to_say: When referring to a city block
example: El restaurante está a dos manzanas (The restaurant is two blocks away) [el res-tow-RAN-teh es-TAH ah dos man-SAH-nas]

when_to_say: When describing location or movement around something
example: Hay muchas tiendas alrededor del parque (There are many shops around the park) [ay MOO-chas tee-EN-das al-reh-deh-DOR del PAR-keh]

when_to_say: When referring to distance in blocks
example: Está a una cuadra de aquí (It's one block from here) [es-TAH ah OO-nah KWAH-drah deh ah-KEE]

when_to_say: When referring to a neighborhood or district
example: Vivo en un barrio tranquilo (I live in a quiet neighborhood) [BEE-boh en oon BAH-ree-oh tran-KEE-loh]

when_to_say: Discussing spatial positioning or navigation
example: La orientación es crucial para no perderse (la o-ree-en-ta-SYON es kroo-SYAL pa-ra no per-DER-seh) - Orientation is crucial to not get lost

when_to_say: Discussing navigation or direction finding
example: Usó la brújula para encontrar el camino (oo-SO la BROO-hoo-la pa-ra en-kon-TRAR el ka-MEE-no) - He used the compass to find the way

when_to_say: Discussing map creation or navigation sciences
example: La cartografía moderna usa tecnología avanzada (la kar-to-gra-FEE-a mo-DER-na oo-sa teh-kno-lo-HEE-a a-van-SA-da) - Modern cartography uses advanced technology

when_to_say: Talking about navigation or travel direction
example: El barco cambió de rumbo inesperadamente (el BAR-ko kam-BEE-o deh ROOM-bo ee-nes-peh-ra-DA-men-teh) - The ship changed course unexpectedly

when_to_say: Discussing geographical features or map details
example: El mapa topográfico muestra todos los relieves (el MA-pa to-po-GRA-fee-ko MWES-tra TO-dos los reh-LEE-eh-ves) - The topographic map shows all terrain features

when_to_say: Discussing precise location or navigation
example: Introdujo las coordenadas en el GPS (een-tro-DOO-ho las ko-or-deh-NA-das en el GPS) - He entered the coordinates in the GPS

when_to_say: Discussing navigation or geographical positioning
example: La triangulación permite localizar con precisión (la tree-an-goo-la-SYON per-MEE-teh lo-ka-lee-SAR kon pre-see-SYON) - Triangulation allows precise localization

when_to_say: Discussing navigation or astronomical positioning
example: El azimut es importante en la navegación (el a-SEE-moot es eem-por-TAN-teh en la na-veh-ga-SYON) - The azimuth is important in navigation

when_to_say: Discussing positioning or giving directions
example: Necesito orientarme en esta ciudad nueva (neh-seh-SEE-to o-ree-en-TAR-meh en ES-ta see-oo-DAD NWEH-va) - I need to orient myself in this new city

when_to_say: Discussing travel routes or navigation
example: Cambió el derrotero de su viaje (kam-BEE-o el deh-ro-TEH-ro deh soo vee-AHE) - He changed the course of his trip

when_to_say: Talking about navigation or travel
example: El navegante guió el barco con maestría (el na-veh-GAN-teh gee-O el BAR-ko kon ma-es-TREE-a) - The navigator guided the ship with mastery

when_to_say: Discussing location tracking or GPS technology
example: La geolocalización ayuda a encontrar lugares (la heh-o-lo-ka-lee-sa-SYON a-YOO-da a en-kon-TRAR loo-GA-res) - Geolocation helps find locations

when_to_say: When referring to the action of speaking or talking
example: Me gusta hablar español (I like to speak Spanish) [meh GOOS-tah ah-BLAR es-pan-YOHL]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of eating
example: Vamos a comer pizza (Let's eat pizza) [BAH-mos ah koh-MEHR PEET-sah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of drinking
example: Necesito beber agua (I need to drink water) [neh-seh-SEE-toh beh-BEHR AH-gwah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of sleeping
example: Voy a dormir temprano (I'm going to sleep early) [boy ah dor-MEER tem-PRAH-noh]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of working
example: Trabajo en una oficina (I work in an office) [trah-BAH-hoh en OO-nah oh-fee-SEE-nah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of studying
example: Necesito estudiar para el examen (I need to study for the exam) [neh-seh-SEE-toh es-too-dee-AR pah-rah el eks-AH-men]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of walking
example: Me gusta caminar en el parque (I like to walk in the park) [meh GOOS-tah kah-mee-NAR en el PAR-keh]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of running
example: Corro todas las mañanas (I run every morning) [KO-roh TOH-das las mah-NYAH-nas]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of writing
example: Me gusta escribir cartas (I like to write letters) [meh GOOS-tah es-kree-BEER KAR-tas]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of reading
example: Leo un libro interesante (I'm reading an interesting book) [LEH-oh oon LEE-broh in-teh-reh-SAN-teh]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of dancing
example: Me encanta bailar salsa (I love to dance salsa) [meh en-KAN-tah bai-LAR SAL-sah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of singing
example: Canto en la ducha (I sing in the shower) [KAN-toh en lah DOO-chah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of listening
example: Escucho música clásica (I listen to classical music) [es-KOO-cho MOO-see-kah KLAH-see-kah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of looking or watching
example: Me gusta mirar las estrellas (I like to look at the stars) [meh GOOS-tah mee-RAR las es-TREH-yas]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of cooking
example: Me gusta cocinar paella (I like to cook paella) [meh GOOS-tah koh-see-NAR pah-EH-yah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of playing (games or sports)
example: Me gusta jugar al fútbol (I like to play soccer) [meh GOOS-tah hoo-GAR al FOOT-bol]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of swimming
example: Nado en la piscina (I swim in the pool) [NAH-doh en lah pee-SEE-nah]

when_to_say: When referring to the action of traveling
example: Me encanta viajar por Europa (I love traveling through Europe) [meh en-KAN-tah bee-ah-HAR por eh-OO-ro-pah]

when_to_say: Describing emotional or mental disturbance
example: No quiero perturbar tu concentración (no kee-E-ro per-tur-BAR too kon-sen-tra-see-ON) - I don't want to disturb your concentration

when_to_say: Expressing contempt or rejection
example: Desdeñó la oferta sin pensarlo (des-de-NYO la o-FER-ta seen pen-SAR-lo) - He scorned the offer without thinking

when_to_say: Describing variable or changing conditions
example: Los precios oscilan constantemente (los PRE-see-os os-see-LAN kon-stan-te-MEN-te) - Prices constantly fluctuate

when_to_say: Discussing theories or probable scenarios
example: Los científicos conjeturan sobre el fenómeno (los see-en-TEE-fee-kos kon-he-too-RAN so-BRE el fe-NO-me-no) - The scientists speculate about the phenomenon

when_to_say: Describing overlapping objects or concepts
example: Las nubes solapan el horizonte (las NOO-bes so-LA-pan el o-ree-SON-te) - The clouds overlap the horizon

meaning: to dissect, to analyze in detail
when_to_say: Discussing detailed analytical processes
example: Vamos a diseccionar el problema (VA-mos a dee-sek-see-o-NAR el pro-BLE-ma) - Let's dissect the problem

when_to_say: Describing protection or giving refuge
example: Nos cobijamos de la lluvia (nos ko-bee-HA-mos de la YOO-vee-a) - We sheltered from the rain

when_to_say: Explaining complex ideas or solving mysteries
example: Necesitamos dilucidar este misterio (ne-se-see-TA-mos dee-loo-see-DAHR ES-te mis-TE-ree-o) - We need to elucidate this mystery

when_to_say: Describing reduction or decrease
example: Las reservas menguan rápidamente (las re-SER-vas men-GWAN ra-pee-da-MEN-te) - The reserves are diminishing rapidly

when_to_say: Discussing data interpretation or prediction
example: Los investigadores extrapolan los datos (los een-ves-tee-ga-DO-res eks-tra-po-LAN los DA-tos) - The researchers extrapolate the data

when_to_say: Expressing preference or pouring carefully
example: Me decanto por la primera opción (me de-KAN-to por la pree-ME-ra op-see-ON) - I lean towards the first option

when_to_say: Discussing opposing forces or neutralizing effects
example: Intentamos contrarrestar la influencia negativa (een-ten-TA-mos kon-tra-rres-TAR la een-floo-EN-see-a ne-ha-TEE-va) - We try to counteract the negative influence

when_to_say: When referring to the spring season
example: La primavera es mi estación favorita (Spring is my favorite season) [lah pree-mah-VEH-rah es mee es-tah-see-ON fah-vor-EE-tah]

when_to_say: When referring to the summer season
example: En verano hace mucho calor (In summer it's very hot) [en veh-RAH-noh AH-seh MOO-cho kah-LOR]

when_to_say: When referring to the autumn/fall season
example: Las hojas caen en otoño (The leaves fall in autumn) [las OH-has KAH-en en oh-TOH-nyoh]

when_to_say: When referring to the winter season
example: Nieva mucho en invierno (It snows a lot in winter) [nee-EH-vah MOO-cho en een-vee-EHR-noh]

when_to_say: When referring to rain
example: Hay lluvia esta mañana (There is rain this morning) [ay YOO-vee-ah ES-tah mah-NYAH-nah]

when_to_say: When referring to snow
example: Me encanta jugar en la nieve (I love playing in the snow) [meh en-KAN-tah hoo-GAR en lah nee-EH-veh]

when_to_say: When describing sunny weather
example: Hoy está soleado (Today is sunny) [oy es-TAH sol-eh-AH-doh]

when_to_say: When describing cloudy weather
example: El cielo está nublado (The sky is cloudy) [el see-EH-loh es-TAH noo-BLAH-doh]

when_to_say: When referring to hot weather or feeling hot
example: Hace mucho calor hoy (It's very hot today) [AH-seh MOO-cho kah-LOR oy]

when_to_say: When referring to cold weather or feeling cold
example: Hace frío esta noche (It's cold tonight) [AH-seh FREE-oh ES-tah NO-cheh]

when_to_say: When referring to wind
example: Hay mucho viento hoy (It's very windy today) [ay MOO-cho vee-EN-toh oy]

when_to_say: When referring to a storm
example: Viene una tormenta (A storm is coming) [vee-EN-eh OO-nah tor-MEN-tah]

when_to_say: When referring to humidity or humid conditions
example: Hay mucha humedad en verano (There's a lot of humidity in summer) [ay MOO-cha oo-meh-DAHD en veh-RAH-noh]

when_to_say: When referring to lightning during a storm
example: Vi un relámpago durante la tormenta (I saw lightning during the storm) [vee oon reh-LAM-pah-goh doo-RAN-teh lah tor-MEN-tah]

when_to_say: When referring to thunder during a storm
example: El trueno me asusta (Thunder scares me) [el TROO-eh-noh meh ah-SOOS-tah]

when_to_say: When referring to a period of specific weather conditions
example: Este temporal durará toda la semana (This weather spell will last all week) [ES-teh tem-por-AL doo-ra-RAH TOH-dah lah seh-MAH-nah]

when_to_say: When describing clear skies or weather
example: El cielo está despejado hoy (The sky is clear today) [el see-EH-loh es-TAH des-peh-HAH-doh oy]

when_to_say: When referring to hail
example: Está cayendo granizo (It's hailing) [es-TAH kah-YEN-doh grah-NEE-soh]

when_to_say: Describing spring growth or metaphorical blooming
example: Las flores florecen en primavera (las FLO-res flo-RE-sen en pree-ma-VE-ra) - The flowers bloom in spring

when_to_say: Describing plant decay or seasonal changes
example: Las hojas se marchitan en otoño (las O-has se mar-chee-TAN en o-TO-nyo) - The leaves wither in autumn

meaning: to sprout again, to become green again
when_to_say: Describing regrowth or renewal in nature
example: Los campos reverdecen después del invierno (los KAM-pos re-ver-DE-sen des-PUES del een-VYER-no) - The fields become green again after winter

when_to_say: Describing winter conditions or freezing
example: El lago se hela en invierno (el LA-go se E-la en een-VYER-no) - The lake freezes in winter

meaning: to feel oppressive heat, to become sweltering
when_to_say: Describing extreme summer heat
example: Me abochorné durante la ola de calor (me a-bo-chor-NE du-RAN-te la O-la de ka-LOR) - I felt oppressed by the heat wave

meaning: to lose leaves, to become leafless
when_to_say: Describing autumn tree changes
example: Los árboles se defolian en otoño (los AR-bo-les se de-fo-LEE-an en o-TO-nyo) - The trees lose their leaves in autumn

when_to_say: Describing spring growth and planting
example: Las semillas germinan en primavera (las se-MEE-yas her-MEE-nan en pree-ma-VE-ra) - The seeds germinate in spring

meaning: to become lukewarm, to warm up
when_to_say: Describing temperature changes in spring
example: El clima se entibía después del invierno (el KLEE-ma se en-tee-BEE-a des-PUES del een-VYER-no) - The climate warms up after winter

when_to_say: Describing wind during different seasons
example: El viento sopla fuerte en invierno (el VYEN-to SO-pla FWER-te en een-VYER-no) - The wind blows strongly in winter

when_to_say: Describing leaf fall in autumn
example: Los árboles se deshojaron rápidamente (los AR-bo-les se des-o-HA-ron ra-pee-DA-men-te) - The trees shed their leaves quickly

when_to_say: Describing intense seasonal feelings
example: El calor me abruma en verano (el ka-LOR me a-BRU-ma en ve-RA-no) - The heat overwhelms me in summer

when_to_say: Describing intensifying seasonal conditions
example: La lluvia arrecia en otoño (la YOO-vee-a a-RRE-see-a en o-TO-nyo) - The rain intensifies in autumn

when_to_say: Barcelona's famous motto, used to express the club's cultural significance
example: El Barcelona es Més que un club (El bar-se-LO-na es mess keh oon kloob) - Barcelona is more than a club

when_to_say: Common chant by Barcelona supporters
example: ¡Visca el Barça i visca Catalunya! (VEES-ka el BAR-sa ee VEES-ka ka-ta-LOON-ya) - Long live Barça and long live Catalonia!

when_to_say: When referring to basketball sport
example: Juego baloncesto (HWEH-go ba-lon-SESS-to) - I play basketball

when_to_say: When a team scores in basketball
example: ¡Tres puntos, qué canasta! (tres POON-tos, keh ka-NAS-ta) - Three points, what a basket!

when_to_say: When referring to tennis sport
example: Nadal juega tenis (na-DAL HWEH-ga TEH-nees) - Nadal plays tennis

when_to_say: Beginning of Barcelona's anthem
example: Tot el camp és un clam (tot el kamp es oon klam) - The whole field is a cry

when_to_say: When referring to cycling sport
example: El ciclismo es un deporte duro (El see-KLEES-mo es oon de-POR-te DOO-ro) - Cycling is a tough sport

when_to_say: When referring to swimming sport
example: La natación es un buen ejercicio (La na-ta-see-ON es oon bwen eh-her-SEE-see-o) - Swimming is a good exercise

when_to_say: Popular Barcelona supporter chant
example: ¡Força Barça, vamos a ganar! (FOR-sa BAR-sa, VA-mos a ga-NAR) - Go Barça, we're going to win!

when_to_say: When referring to track and field sports
example: El atletismo incluye muchas disciplinas (El at-leh-TEES-mo een-KLOO-yeh MOO-chas dees-see-PLEE-nas) - Athletics includes many disciplines

when_to_say: When referring to volleyball sport
example: Jugamos voleibol en la playa (hoo-GA-mos bo-ley-BOL en la PLA-ya) - We play volleyball at the beach

when_to_say: When referring to Barcelona supporters
example: Los culers están celebrando (Los koo-LERS es-TAN se-le-BRAN-do) - The Barcelona fans are celebrating

when_to_say: When referring to boxing sport
example: El boxeo requiere mucha disciplina (El bok-SEH-o reh-kee-EH-reh MOO-cha dees-see-PLEE-na) - Boxing requires a lot of discipline

when_to_say: When referring to Barcelona's famous youth academy
example: Messi creció en La Masia (MEH-see kreh-see-O en la ma-SEE-a) - Messi grew up in La Masia

when_to_say: When referring to gymnastics sport
example: La gimnasia artística (La him-NA-sia ar-TEES-tee-ka) - Artistic gymnastics

when_to_say: When referring to Barcelona's team colors or the team itself
example: Los colores blaugrana (Los ko-LO-res blao-GRA-na) - The blue and red colors

when_to_say: When referring to baseball sport
example: Un partido de béisbol (Oon par-TEE-do de BAY-is-bol) - A baseball game

when_to_say: When referring to Barcelona's home stadium
example: Juegan en el Camp Nou (HWEH-gan en el kamp noo) - They play at Camp Nou

when_to_say: Discussing sports achievements and awards
example: El Barcelona ganó otro trofeo (el bar-se-LO-na ga-NO o-tro tro-FEH-o) - Barcelona won another trophy

when_to_say: Talking about passionate sports supporters
example: La hinchada del Barça es increíble (la een-CHA-da del BAR-sa es een-kre-EE-ble) - Barcelona's fan base is incredible

when_to_say: Discussing homegrown talent in football
example: Messi fue un canterano del Barcelona (MEH-see fweh un kan-teh-RA-no del bar-se-LO-na) - Messi was a youth academy player of Barcelona

when_to_say: Referring to team leadership
example: Puyol fue un legendario capitán (poo-YOL fweh un le-hen-DA-ryo ka-pee-TAN) - Puyol was a legendary captain

when_to_say: Discussing top scorers in football
example: Suárez es un increíble goleador (swa-REZ es un een-kre-EE-ble go-leh-a-DOR) - Suárez is an incredible goal scorer

when_to_say: Talking about team management
example: Guardiola fue un brillante entrenador (gwar-dee-O-la fweh un bree-YAN-teh en-treh-na-DOR) - Guardiola was a brilliant coach

when_to_say: Discussing player health and sports injuries
example: Una lesión le impidió jugar (oo-na leh-SYON leh eem-pee-DO joo-GAR) - An injury prevented him from playing

when_to_say: Talking about team composition
example: La plantilla del Barcelona es diversa (la plan-TEE-ya del bar-se-LO-na es dee-VER-sa) - Barcelona's squad is diverse

when_to_say: Discussing goal-related situations in football
example: El balón golpeó la portería (el ba-LON gol-PEH-o la por-TEH-ree-a) - The ball hit the goalpost

when_to_say: Describing passionate sports followers
example: Soy un aficionado del Barcelona (soy un a-fee-syo-NA-do del bar-se-LO-na) - I am a Barcelona fan

when_to_say: Discussing international sports competitions
example: Barcelona tiene jugadores de nivel mundial (bar-se-LO-na tee-EH-neh joo-ga-DO-res de nee-VEL mun-dee-AL) - Barcelona has world-class players

when_to_say: Discussing player recruitment and transfers
example: El fichaje fue muy costoso (el fee-CHA-heh fweh mwee kos-TO-so) - The transfer was very expensive
